ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I absolutely loved this class. I learned about how sport is more complex than what meets the eye.
Criticial thinking about sports in society
Lots of stuff I hadnt thought about before  capitalism, diplomacy, neoliberalism in sport. Super chill class and learned a lot

I learned how to evaluate and look at sports from a deeper, more intellectual level. This class taught me the importance of identity in understanding what a success story looks like in sports. This class also taught me how global capitalism can use sports as a tool to further its control over a populace.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The fiery couple of weeks were a brit of a drag, but I understand that they were important for laying the groundwork.
Strengths in this course was to look past just what we see in sports competition and further into its structure
Prof. Had really structured lectures which is rare for a 2-hr slot. It kind of ran like a high school class because of this, but Im not complaining
I think that some of the readings could have been moved around to further emphasize certain topics.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Even though this course does demand engagement with the material and the themes can be complex, it is one of my favorite courses I have taken at Yale. I highly recommend it.
YES! Anyone who likes sports would love this class.
Yes, since most people are interested in sports it is interesting to look into the politics and other sides of sports.
Yeah. Lots of reading but you can make it work
Yes! Theres not too much work involved and you learn a lot about the inner workings of pro sports

I would recommend this class to people with previous sports background to help get the most out of the class. I do think that this is a good introduction to neoliberalism and case studies on how it actually affects people.
